Module com.alike
Package com.alike.time

Class Stopwatch

java.lang.Object
com.alike.time.Stopwatch
public class Stopwatch extends Object
Class can be used to measure execution time of other code by calling start and stop methods, similar to how a stop watch works in real life.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Stopwatch()
    Initialises a new stop watch object.
    Stopwatch(boolean startNow)
    Creates a new stop watch that is starting if the input boolean is true.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    clear()
    Used to reset the stopwatch (so it might be used again)
    long
    getStartTime()
    Returns the value of the @code{startTime} attribute.
    long
    getStopTime()
    Returns the value of the @code{stopTime} attribute.
    long
    getTimeMs()
    Stops the stopwatch if not already stopped and returns the time this stop watch was running for in milliseconds.
    long
    getTimeMus()
    Stops the stopwatch if not already stopped and returns the time this stop watch was running for in micro-seconds.
    long
    getTimeNs()
    Stops the stopwatch if not already stopped and returns the time this stop watch was running for in nano-seconds.
    boolean
    isStarted()
    Returns a boolean that is true if the @code{start()} method has been called.
    void
    setStartTime(long startTime)
    Assigns the value of the @code{startTime} attribute.
    void
    setStopTime(long stopTime)
    Assigns a new value to the @code{stopTime} attribute.
    void
    start()
    Notes a start time for the stop watch.

    stop()
    Notes an end time for the stop watch.

  • Constructor Details

    • Stopwatch

      public Stopwatch()
      Initialises a new stop watch object.

    • Stopwatch

      public Stopwatch(boolean startNow)
      Creates a new stop watch that is starting if the input boolean is true.
      Parameters:
      startNow - Whether this stop watch should be started immediately.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Notes a start time for the stop watch.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Notes an end time for the stop watch.

    • getTimeNs

      public long getTimeNs()
      Stops the stopwatch if not already stopped and returns the time this stop watch was running for in nano-seconds.
      Returns:
      long The number of nano-seconds this stop watch was running for.

    • getTimeMus

      public long getTimeMus()
      Stops the stopwatch if not already stopped and returns the time this stop watch was running for in micro-seconds.
      Returns:
      micro-seconds The time elapsed in micro-seconds.

    • getTimeMs

      public long getTimeMs()
      Stops the stopwatch if not already stopped and returns the time this stop watch was running for in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      milliseconds The time elapsed in milliseconds.

    • getStartTime

      public long getStartTime()
      Returns the value of the @code{startTime} attribute.
      Returns:
      startTime The value of the @code{startTime} attribute.

    • setStartTime

      public void setStartTime(long startTime)
      Assigns the value of the @code{startTime} attribute.
      Parameters:
      startTime - The new value to assign the @code{startTime} attribute.

    • getStopTime

      public long getStopTime()
      Returns the value of the @code{stopTime} attribute.
      Returns:
      stopTime The value of the @code{stopTime} attribute.

    • setStopTime

      public void setStopTime(long stopTime)
      Assigns a new value to the @code{stopTime} attribute.
      Parameters:
      stopTime - The new value to assign the @code{stopTime} attribute.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Used to reset the stopwatch (so it might be used again)

    • isStarted

      public boolean isStarted()
      Returns a boolean that is true if the @code{start()} method has been called.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the stop watch has been started.
